alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 7:10PM MDT until July 31 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Douglas County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 900 PM MDT. * At 710 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, with the heaviest rain between Louviers, Sedalia, Castle Rock, and Castle Pines. Flash flooding is ongoing in areas near and west of Castle Rock. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Castle Rock, western Parker, Roxborough Park, Sedalia, Castle Pines, Louviers, Perry Park and Shamballa. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
